data.chText: （军队对城镇的）围困，包围，围攻，封锁
data.enText: a military operation in which an army tries to capture a town by surrounding it and stopping the supply of food, etc. to the people inside

data.chText: 六个月后封锁最终解除了。
data.enText: The siege was finally lifted (= ended) after six months.

data.chText: 警方可说是已封锁了市中心。
data.enText: The police placed the city centre under a virtual state of siege (= it was hard to get in or out) .
a situation in which the police surround a building where people are living or hiding, in order to make them come out
surrounded by an army or the police in a siege

data.chText: 一再遭到批评的；受…困扰的
data.enText: being criticized all the time or put under pressure by problems, questions, etc.

data.chText: 围困，围攻（城镇、建筑物等）
data.enText: to begin a siege of a town, building, etc.

data.chText: 包围（某建筑物，旨在和里面的人对话或质询）
data.enText: to surround a building, especially in order to speak to or question the person or people living or working there
surrounded by an army or the police in a siege

data.chText: 一再遭到批评的；受…困扰的
data.enText: being criticized all the time or put under pressure by problems, questions, etc.

data.chText: 围困，围攻（城镇、建筑物等）
data.enText: to begin a siege of a town, building, etc.

data.chText: 包围（某建筑物，旨在和里面的人对话或质询）
data.enText: to surround a building, especially in order to speak to or question the person or people living or working there

tr: the action of an armed force that surrounds a fortified place and isolates it while continuing to attack

value.def: A siege is a military or police operation in which soldiers or police surround a place in order to force the people there to come out or give up control of the place.

example.ex: We must do everything possible to lift the siege...
example.tran: 我们必须尽一切可能解除包围。

example.ex: They are hopeful of bringing the siege to a peaceful conclusion...
example.tran: 他们希望能和平结束这次围困。

example.ex: The journalists found a city virtually under siege.
example.tran: 记者发现的是一个几乎被围困的城市。

value.tran: (军队或警察对某地的)围困，包围，围攻

value.def: If police, soldiers, or journalists lay siege to a place, they surround it in order to force the people there to come out or give up control of the place.

example.ex: The rebels laid siege to the governor's residence...
The press laid siege to the club.

value.tran: (警察、士兵、新闻记者等)包围，围住

value.def: If someone or something is under siege, they are being severely criticized or put under a great deal of pressure.

example.ex: The guy'll think he's under siege...
example.tran: 那家伙会认为他承受了巨大压力。

example.ex: Radio One is under siege from all sides.
example.tran: 广播一台受到了来自各方的严厉批评。

value.tran: 遭受严厉批评;承受巨大压力

trans: 遭受严厉批评;承受巨大压力
